vialab.SMT.event

Class SwipeKeyEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • vialab.SMT.event.SwipeKeyEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SwipeKeyEvent
extends java.util.EventObject
    An event class that describes parts of a swipe gesture.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • SWIPE_STARTED

        public static final int SWIPE_STARTED
        One of the possible values for the id field. Indicates the beginning of the swipe.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SWIPE_HIT

        public static final int SWIPE_HIT
        One of the possible values for the id field. Indicates a setp in the swipe.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SWIPE_ENDED

        public static final int SWIPE_ENDED
        One of the possible values for the id field. Indicates the end of the swipe.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwipeKeyEvent

        public SwipeKeyEvent(java.lang.Object source,
             int id,
             int keyCode,
             char keyChar,
             int keyLocation,
             Touch touch)
        Constructor for this class.
        Parameters:
        source - The object that invoked this event.
        id - Defines the type of Swipe event that occured. Must be one of: SWIPE_STARTED, SWIPE_HIT, or SWIPE_ENDED.
        keyCode - The key code of the key involved in the event.
        keyChar - The key char of the key involved in the event.
        keyLocation - The location of the key on the keyboard. See java.awt.event.KeyEvent's keyLocation field for details.
        touch - The touch involved in the event.
